headline: Classic and Simple Meat Lasagna
description: This lasagna with ground beef, whole wheat noodles, prepared sauce, and plenty of mozzarella cheese is an easy, yet hearty family-pleasing dish.

video.description: Here's a hearty yet simple meat lasagna that's perfect for a cozy night in.
video.name: Clasic and Simple Meat Lasagna

name: Classic and Simple Meat Lasagna
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon dried oregano, or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add lasagna noodles and cook for 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.
Meanwhile, place ground beef, garlic, oregano, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir until beef is crumbly and evenly browned, about 10 minutes.
Mix cottage cheese, Parmesan cheese, and eggs together in a large bowl until thoroughly combined.

Lay 4 noodles side by side on the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking pan; top with a layer of prepared tomato-basil sauce, a layer of ground beef mixture, and a layer of cottage cheese mixture. Repeat layers twice more, ending with a layer of sauce; sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top. Cover the dish with aluminum foil.

Bake in the preheated oven until the lasagna is bubbling and the cheese has melted, about 30 minutes. Remove foil and bake until cheese has begun to brown, about 10 more minutes. Allow to stand at least 10 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: It was good company harped on it

My lasagna came out great! My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed the taste and the creamy texture. I didn't use any eggs in mine though. The only thing that didn't go as planned was that the cheese never got that nice golden brown colour - no matter what I did. At the end of the day, it tasted fantastic, and that's what really matters!
HELLO CHEF ,HERE I am with a great good news for you about the khal.com a cooking land for cooking kings and queens like you.??
Delicious and so easy to follow. I’m not much of a cook and I loved it.
Absolutely amazing! My husband said it was best he’d ever had, and he couldn’t get enough
Delicious
Very popular at my house!
Easy and so yummy.
I only 4 star it because 1 pound of meat is not enough for more than 2 layers of lasagna. Definitely will need a mother pound of meat to make it even and consistent
Great

I had good results from this recipe. I only made a few changes with using cooked noodles and I used ricotta cheese and no parmesan. It came out well done. My Mother said it was tasty. I would make this recipe again.

I tried the recipe and I have to admit it was good; I was very sceptical about the whole wheat noodles but couldn't tell the difference and instead of cottage cheese and used ricotta cheese and added some extra garlic. And it turned out bubbly and gooey and delicious.
Turned out great. Even my pickeast eaters asked for more! Will make again!!!!
Great!

This recipe was great. I made the recipe as is. Just like it said. It was a 5 star recipe as is!! I’m tired of people leaving a review after they’ve changed the recipe to the point it’s not the same recipe. If you people are so good, then post your recipe as a new one. No one really cares about your ridiculous Additions to the ingredients. If you’re going to post a review, then post it AS IS!! 
Your changes are not the recipe so your 5 stars don’t mean a thing. Your recipe probably doesn’t hold water to this person’s recipe. So either do some work or leave a legitimate review. Anyway this recipe as is was great!!
FC
Super easy and delicious!

half dose (4 servings), used bread pan, ground pork, aged gruyere (melted in pan) instead of cottage cheese, ~1 jar pasta sauce, 6 lasagna noodles, and added extra diced garlic, mushrooms, and onions in each of the two layers.
This worked well with gluten free lasagna noodles for a delish meal!
Very good!! Thanks for posting this recipe :)
Will make again

Very easy to make and everyone loved it! Lasagna can be an intimidating meal to make. But this recipe was so easy! Used no-boil noodles, and started with a layer of sauce on the bottom first before adding the first layer of noodles. Also added some milk to the recipe to increase liquid ratio for the noodles. Turned out great and children have requested this recipe be added to our regular rotation! So thank you!
My family and I loved this recipe. It was gone within a day. I will definitely make this again.

Okay, I give this 4 stars because I try it their way, and I had a problem with cottage cheese being used. So I go back to my tried and true. First of all, if you use the flat "No need to boil" lasagna noodles it will taste even more Italian homemade. Second, don't use cottage cheese because if people don't like cottage cheese right out of the container because of texture they will have the same issues eating lasagna with it. Instead, if you must have that authentic cheese filling because I prefer mine without it, use the RICOTTA cheese instead and stir in lots of shredded parmesan cheese and about 1 tablespoon oregano and 1 egg (egg not necessary if you use lots of parmesan as the binder). 
Another tip is if no one has an aversion to pork in the family take a 1lb package of breakfast sausage and mix in about 2 tbs of Italian seasoning, fry, and drain and add it in along with the ground beef.
Also, make a small pot of sauce or jars of marinara sauce you heat up on the stove. So those who like extra sauce can put it on the plate first and put the slice of lasagna on top of the extra sauce. This way you don't have to fret over if it's too dry or not. If they think it's dry add extra sauce and get over it.
I add vegetables to it

Simple, came out great. Easy to follow.

Minor Tweaks on mine : 2 lbs of meat, 2 jars of sauce, Ricotta cheese. Mix the (browned) beef with sauce to make it easier to spread in the pan. Throw cheese in the middle layer for fullness
This is a good recipe. Everyone enjoyed it.

Only 4 stars because I had to add more ground beef and sauce. On hind sight I would have saved just enough sauce for the bottom and top layers and mixed the rest with the ground beef. That said, I couldn’t hear any complaints over the smacking at the dinner table.

This was the first time I successfully made homemade lasagna and it turned out amazing!

I tried two times before without a recipe because the person whose lasagna I liked as a kid told me she never used written directions and just dumped the basic ingredients of cheese, noodles, meat and sauce in layers and baked it.

My attempts at doing it her way were... disasters.

This recipe turned out very well, although I goofed up and added a final layer of noodles on top just under the cheese (I also sprinkled some mozzarella within the layers as well).

Would highly recommend!
Made it a couple of months ago, and it came out absolutely wonderful. Looking to try it more and more until I have it memorized ^_^

I absolutely love this recipe, although I don’t follow it 100%. Here are some of the changes I make: I usually cook 2-3 lbs ground beef because we like our lasagna meaty over here! I use a decent amount of seasoning (seasoned salt, pepper, oregano, Italian seasoning) and another tsp or 2 minced garlic when cooking the meat, and I use ricotta cheese instead of cottage cheese. Since I make it with more meat, I use 32 oz of ricotta cheese and 4 eggs instead of two.One must? Thoroughly season your ricotta/cottage cheese mixture!! I season mine with Italian seasoning; seasoning salt, pepper, garlic salt and pepper, and oregano. Since I use more meat, I also usually have to cook it a little bit longer. I normally cook it 45 minutes or more before I remove the foil for the last 20 minutes or so to brown the cheese. One last little tip I have is to stick four toothpicks in it so your foil doesn’t take away all your cheese!
My family loved it.

I loved this recipe!!! Super simple I used oven ready noodles so I didn’t even cook them just added baking time until the noodles softened and I also substituted ricotta cheese for the cottage cheese! So easy and delish! I would only add maybe a bit more cheese throughout but overall super tasty for the amount of effort I put into it!
The lasagne was very tasty and this was an easy recipe for making lasagne for the first time.
Delicious Delicious delicious! Substituted cottage cheese with skim ricotta.
Pretty good, but with necessary changes forced by lack of supplies. Nice, easy and some very helpful comments in the reviews.

Great simple recipe. I made a few modifications, fresh lasagna pasta, ricotta cheese in addition to cottage and more sauce to make it a bit bigger. The cook time in oven seems to be quite understated. Took about 60-70 min in the oven.
This recipe is awesome! I used a bit more seasoning and added Italian sausage when I cooked the ground beef for a better taste... but besides that this recipe was definitely great!
This recipe was magea gay idk why yall posted this its trash
Turned out really well, I used Parmesan cheese out of the shaker, (wasn’t as good, taste too strong) overall, I used one egg and was pretty tasty
No changes, my family. \loved it so much, they said make this every day !!!!!
Very easy to prepare and makes a delicous result. I could go without the mozzarella on top.

It turned out really good. I used to big of a pan and didn’t have a lot of layers but I know now what to do. Thank you so much for the 
easy recipe

this turned out phenominal. Though it really appeared during prep that the layer fillings (which were difficult to spread throughout) were going to make the dish appear thin and unfilled, the cooking process evened it all out. I made some minor modifications to it, based on personal taste, but the meal turned out beautifully.

I had some fresh mushrooms I needed to use, so I sauteed them, and added them to the first layer, atop the layer of lasagna noodles and a can of plain tomato based pasta sauce. Next level was ground beef and pork sauteed with onion/garlic and covered with a jar of pasta sauce with meat in it, and the layer of pasta again. Next was the ricotta cheese layer and noodles. Last layer was spicy chicken Italian sausage covered with a jar of spicy sausage sauce. I discovered too late that I had only a bit of mozzarella cheese, so I mixed it with my plentiful mild cheddar cheese and parmesan, and covered the entire casserole with it before baking under foil for the hour. I made my 16" x 12" x 3" roaster full for leftovers guaranteed. This was way easier than I expected!
I added 16 Oz of ricotta cheese and a couple of handfuls of freshly chopped spinach to the cheese mixture- then a can of mushroom pieces and stems to the meat sauce- best lasagna ever!
Family loveeeees this

You need more sauce and more meat for this recipie. I doubled the meat (and could have used a little more). I used 2 full jars of sauce and a 320 bag of shredded cheese for top. I never altered the recipie ingredients other than using white needles instead of while wheat and I didn’t have fresh parmesan so I used the grated 100% parmesan. Recipie is awesome, a keeper for sure.
The best simple and easy recipe

This recipe was easy and delicious. I followed the recipe except I only had one jar of pasta sauce 16 oz and added one 14 oz can tomato sauce to it, worked out perfectly fine. I didn't use whole wheat lasagna noodles either, just regular ones. Looking forward to making it again--hopefully very soon.
Followed the recipe & it was wonderful! I might play around & add mushrooms or spinach next time.
I used ricotta cheese instead of cottage cheese. Yum

Next time in the future, i'll add the sauce while cooking the beef to not only add flavor, but, to make it easier when preparing to layer and bake in the oven. Also using tomato paste to make the beef have more flavor.

I used 2lbs of ground beef & 1lb of italian sausage and 2 whole jars of sauce. The 9x13 was nice and full and baked for 1 hour. 1 1/2 lb of meat wouldnt do much feeding the guys. But yes, this is my future lasagna recipe.
Easy to make. Great taste, family loves this enough huge helpings for six......
This was tasty and very easy to make. I used ricotta though instead of cottage cheese. Thanks for the great recipe!

My family loved it. The cottage cheese made it a bit less heavy in the cheese department, which worked for those who like it more balanced. Instead of 1 lb. of ground beef, I used 3/4 lb of ground beef and 1/4 lb of sweet Italian sausage. They liked this zesty flavor. Storing the rest of it in individual pieces in freezer for microwaving later.
First time making it and I want to keep cooking I'm so happy! ??
Delicious!!
Base on other reviews doubled the recipe and used ricotta cheese instead of cottage cheese and split into 3 8x8 pans so we could freeze 2. It was really good.
I've always liked lasagne! and this was such a simple recipe! I'll make eggplant lasagne next week.
I love it. Will make it again.
Yes, I added onions and organic basil to it.. Very delicious. Yes I will make this again. THANK YOU!
Simple easy to prepare and taste good too. Next time I will add my own pasta sauce to compare.
I find that typically I have to make twice as much as the recipe recommends to feed three people, but we are also three hungry people and we love this so much.
Fantastic with a few tweaks here and there. Great with cream of mushroom or cream of chicken soup!

This recipe needs twice the amount of tomato sauce listed, but otherwise it turned out very well. I made a few tweaks to the cottage cheese/egg/parm layer. I used low fat cottage cheese instead of full fat. I also chopped about 1 cup fresh spinach and added 1/2 tbsp dried basil to this layer. Next time I will probably use low fat ricotta instead.

Used this Recipe once before. But like the first time to me and my family it was still a little dry double put the sauce and it came out perfect. And added a little sweet / spicy Italian sausage. Will definitely make this more often

This was so delicious! I'm only will give it 4/5 stars because I made 2 changes. I had ricotta on hand so I used that instead of the cottage cheese. And I had ready to bake noodles instead of the whole wheat boiling required kind.
I will make this again! Absolutely!
Lasagna was perfect! My family Loved it so much...I was told to make it more often. Would definitely make it again!
I tried this and my family loved it! I made it a second time and substituted for ricotta cheese but I have to say I prefer the recipe just how it is!

I made this lasagna but I changed a few ingredients. I used ricotta cheese instead of cottage cheese, regular noodles instead of whole wheat (also oven-ready so no need to boil), and I used Italian sausage out of the casing with ground beef. It was about 3 pounds of meat all in all. One pound of meat is not enough for a 9x13 pan of lasagna. It was very delicious the only thing I would change about how I made it was the sauce... I did not put enough sauce in there but it was still tasty. I highly recommend.
It was a huge hit with my girlfriend, her son,(who won't eat ANYTHING unless I make it, LOL, THANKS ALLRECIPES!!!), her mother and especially her Father
My favorite dish
Love the ease of this and definitely one of my families favorite :) I do add an extra cup of beef and sauce ;)
I subbed out cottage cheese for ricotta, only reasoning is because that's how my mom used to make it and i hate cottage cheese
The only I made was using Italian venison sausage. So good and seasoned just right. It is hunting season and sometimes I just need to change up recipes to use the meat.

Made it exactly as described except I used Ricotta cheese instead of cottage cheese, and used spaghetti sauce and mixed in the ground beef to make it easier to spread... first time making lasagna - my husband said it was the best he's ever had!
Dinner was lovely. Used zest and spices sauce instead to give it a different kick. Added basil to the sauce to stay on track with the recipe. Also added olive oil to the ground beef when cooking.
The easiest lasagna ever!! You'd need to try hard to mess it up. So yummy too!

I gave it a 5 star for simplicity in steps and process. Actually easier than I thought. The only change I made was I added creamy basil Alfredo aged Parmesan cheese to the cottage cheese and egg mix because I had gotten 8oz jar, instead of 16 oz, so I added that to sort of "stretch" the cottage cheese. But it taste very good.
It was really good. Everyone loves it! THANKS!!! :)
I don't make it whole wheat and I add 3 eggs instead of 2 and it's HEAVENLY!
First time making lasagna and it turned out delicious!
Pretty good recipe. Next time I'll use more sauce.

Family loved it, will definitely make again! I used Mexican queso fresco instead of cottage or ricotta cheese (didn't have either on hand) which gave the dish some counterbalance to all that melted mozzarella cheese. Although, I had doubled the cheese amounts than what the recipe called for, it was still not enough for layering. I ended up (generously) layering in mozzarella cheese. I used an organic, diced tomato and basil sauce which gave the final dish a rustic finish, but the recipe definitely needs more sauce. Pair it with a good wine and enjoy.

Delicious recipe. I did make a few changes to suit my family's needs. I used 2 pounds of ground turkey, 9 lasagna noodles, 16 ounces of ricotta cheese along with Fiesta blend cheesed and Mexican blend cheese. Followed the recipe to the tee other than that. Excellent taste and it held together very well.

I used only 3 lasagna noodles on each layer since 4 wouldn’t fit across my pan. I also used Prego meat-flavored sauce, so I sprinkled dried basil on each layer. It really added to the flavor. While this is good, ricotta would have made it richer tasting.
Love the simplicity
Very easy prep - my entire fussy family loved it!

Yes, very easy. I like the cottage cheese; creamier. I also put in the middle a layer of leftover spinach/artichoke dip I'd made the night before. Since my son likes cheese I mixed in to the cottage chees some Parmesan/Romano and sprinkled some on top before adding shredded mozzarella about 30 minutes into the baking. Lastly after cooling for 10 min. I sprinkled on some fresh parsley. Yum!
Delicious
I made this lasagna a few times using this recipe. It was very delicious. The only thing I would do different is use more cottage cheese. That made the recipe complete.
Used all organic ingredients and changed the cottage cheese to ricotta. It turned out wonderful. Would definitely make it again, and was so easy.
So easy to make. I opt out on the whole cottage cheese and I replaced ground beef with ground chicken. It was absolutely delicious.
My son loved, this. Simple to make, made no changes.
I loved making this for my family! I will certainly do it again.

This is an insanely good Lasagna that requires so little work to make compared to other Recipes. As someone who doesn't like cottage cheese, I cannot imagine having Lasagna without it now.

However, I would recommend increasing the cheese mixture by about 50% depending on the side of your pan. My pan ended up being a little large and ended up with poor overall coverage with the cottage cheese mixture.
Super easy and delicious!
yummy and easy
